title: How to Make a Poll on Your Snapchat Story (Easy 2024 Guide)

steps.title: Yes, Snapchat does have a built-in poll feature.
steps.content: Yes, Snapchat does have a built-in poll feature. The poll sticker allows you to post a question and select two emojis for your audience to choose between. Snapchat polls don’t have a multiple choice or text answer option. Snapchat polls can’t be anonymously answered. When someone answers a Snapchat poll, the poll poster can see who voted on which emoji. You can use 3rd party polls to create an anonymous poll.

steps.title: Open the Snapchat app.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat app. (It’s the yellow icon with a white ghost inside). The app will open to the camera screen.

steps.title: Tap the camera button to take a picture.
steps.content: Tap the camera button to take a picture. It’s the white circle at the bottom of the camera screen. [2] X Research source This picture will be the background of your poll. You can take a picture of something related to the poll to provide more context to your audience. For example, you could post a photo of a new shirt and ask “should I wear this shirt on a first date?”

steps.title: Tap the sticker button.
steps.content: Tap the sticker button. It’s the white square on the right side of the photo editing screen. This will open the sticker drawer. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the poll button.
steps.content: Tap the poll button. It’s at the top of the drawer in the star section of the sticker drawer. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Type your question.
steps.content: Type your question. Your question will appear in the Ask a question box above the thumbs up and thumbs down icons.

steps.title: Tap done when you finish typing your question.
steps.content: Tap done when you finish typing your question. You can edit your question text by tapping on the sticker. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the thumbs up emoji.
steps.content: Tap the thumbs up emoji. When you tap either default thumbs emoji, an emoji selection menu will open at the bottom of the screen. You can skip this step if you want to stick with the thumbs up and thumbs down emojis.

steps.title: Tap the emoji you want.
steps.content: Tap the emoji you want. Changing the emoji is a great way to get specific opinions on a topic. [6] X Research source For example, you could post the question “How does everyone feel about tonight’s math homework?” Then, select a smiling emoji and frowning emoji to see how your friends are doing on the homework.

steps.title: Move your poll to the desired location.
steps.content: Move your poll to the desired location. You can move the poll and change its size just like any sticker on Snapchat.

steps.title: Tap the stories button at the bottom of the Snap.
steps.content: Tap the stories button at the bottom of the Snap. Here, you can choose which stories to send your poll Snap to.

steps.title: Tap the stories you want to post to.
steps.content: Tap the stories you want to post to. You can choose your normal story (My Story), a Private story, or a Shared story. [7] X Research source You can also post the Snap to the Snap Map. Your poll Snap can be posted to one or more stories. Tap and select multiple stories to choose where you want to post the poll.

steps.title: Tap the arrow button in the bottom right of the Snap story menu.
steps.content: Tap the arrow button in the bottom right of the Snap story menu. This will post your Snap with your poll to the story you selected. You can view your current story on your profile page under the My Stories, Private Stories, or Shared Stories sections. From there, you can check for any typos and see who has viewed the Snap.

steps.title: Tap the profile button.
steps.content: Tap the profile button. It’s located in the top left of the camera, chat, or stories screen.

steps.title: Tap the story button with the poll.
steps.content: Tap the story button with the poll. The story button is the circle with a preview of the story image.

steps.title: Tap the vertical three dots button.
steps.content: Tap the vertical three dots button. It’s in the top right of the story Snap.

steps.title: Tap the poll question.
steps.content: Tap the poll question. This will show you the current voting results of the poll.

steps.title: Tap the send results button.
steps.content: Tap the send results button. This will start the process for sharing your results. Posting the poll results is optional.

steps.title: Tap the stories you want to share the results to.
steps.content: Tap the stories you want to share the results to. You can post the results to multiple stories.

steps.title: Tap the send button to share the results.
steps.content: Tap the send button to share the results. This will post the results of your poll to the stories you selected.

steps.title: Tap on the poll emojis when viewing other people’s stories.
steps.content: Tap on the poll emojis when viewing other people’s stories. You can vote on polls in your friends’ stories or public stories . To see the results of other people’s polls, you’ll need to wait for them to post the results (or you can try asking them directly by sending them a Snap).

steps.title: Yes, there are 3rd party polling alternatives.
steps.content: Yes, there are 3rd party polling alternatives. Many polling services offer more features than the built-in Snapchat poll. This is great for users who want to post polls with more choices or text responses. You can try SurveyMonkey if you want to post a survey with multiple questions and a customized design. You’ll be able to see analytics like charts and filtered data. For this option, you would attach your SurveyMonkey survey link to the Snap you post to your story. [8] X Research source Doodle’s quick survey is another way to make a poll. There are options to limit the number of votes and make the survey hidden. To post the Doodle poll to your story, you would copy the survey link and attach it to a Snap. [9] X Research source
